    Vignette Title

    Vignette Author

    2020-06-15

    basic.Rmd

    todos

    setting up specific hypothesis (dif between two groups)

    • adding “random each run” option

    • not setting Rasch Model beta Parameters once in the beginning, but drawing random parameters for each run of the power function (more robust)

    • adding “sample size” function that uses the power function in a smart way to derive n for a given power.

    Basic Workflow

    The basic worklow is illustrated with testing DIF in the Rasch Model with an Andersen LR Test.

    model <- setup.model(architecture = "Rasch", n.items= 20, beta = rnorm(20), pers.dist = "normal")

altmodel <- setup.alternative(class="2PL")

test1 <- setup.test(type = "AndersenLR")

power(model = model, altmodel=altmodel, test = test1, effect.size = .01,alpha = .05, n=100,runs=5)
#> Warning in uniroot(opt.func, c(0, 100)): NA/Inf durch größte positive Zahl
#> ersetzt
#> Warning in LRtest.Rm(rm): 
#> The following items were excluded due to inappropriate response patterns within
#> subgroups:
#> 18
#> 
#> Full and subgroup models are estimated without these items!
#> [1] 0.6
